meta.title: Implement JWT authentication system with refresh tokens

task.role: You are a Senior Security Engineer with expertise in authentication and secure coding. Implement Task 3 with production-quality code.

context.overview: Build JWT-based authentication with access and refresh token generation, validation middleware, and secure token storage in Redis
context.background: Review PRD and architecture in .tasks/docs/ for full context.

requirements.description: 1. Add dependencies: jsonwebtoken = "9", argon2 = "0.5", uuid = { version = "1", features = ["v4", "serde"] } 2. Create src/domain/auth.rs with: - struct Claims { sub: Uuid, exp: i64, role: String } - fn generate_access_token(user_id: Uuid, role: String) -> Result<String> (15min expiry) - fn generate_refresh_token() -> String (7 days, store in Redis with user_id) 3. Implement password hashing with argon2 4. Create POST /api/auth/register and /api/auth/login endpoints 5. Build Axum middleware in src/api/middleware/auth.rs: - Extract JWT from Authorization header - Validate signature and expiry - Inject user context into request extensions 6. Store refresh tokens in Redis with key pattern: refresh_token:{token} -> user_id

constraints.constraint: PR title: feat(task-3): Implement JWT authentication system with refresh tokens

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Unit test token generation/validation. Integration test: register user, login, access protected endpoint with token, refresh token flow. Test expired token rejection
